meanings.definition: Produced by humans rather than occurring naturally.
meanings.sent1: The factitious flowers in the vase brightened up the room.
meanings.sent2: The factitious leather jacket looked almost real.
meanings.sent3: The factitious smile on the mannequin's face seemed frozen in time.
meanings.sent4: Her factitious enthusiasm for the project was evident to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The factitious laughter echoed through the empty hallways.

meanings.sent1: The factitious flavors in the candy tasted too sweet.
meanings.sent2: Her factitious apology did not seem sincere.
meanings.sent3: The factitious painting mimicked a famous artist's style.
meanings.sent4: The factitious smile on the robot's face seemed eerie.
meanings.sent5: The factitious intelligence of the machine impressed the scientists.

meanings.sent1: His factitious excuses for being late were easily seen through.
meanings.sent2: The factitious designer bags were sold at a fraction of the price.
meanings.sent3: The factitious diamond ring turned out to be a clever imitation.
meanings.sent4: Her factitious concern for her rival was met with suspicion.
meanings.sent5: The factitious emotions in the play moved the audience to tears.
